meanings.definition: The quality or state of being incombustible.
meanings.sent1: The incombustibilities of the fireproof material ensured safety in the building.
meanings.sent2: The firefighter praised the incombustibilities of the new equipment.
meanings.sent3: The incombustibilities of the superhero's cape made him invincible to fire attacks.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was like the incombustibilities of a flame that never dies out.
meanings.sent5: The incombustibilities of the diamond made it a valuable and enduring gem.

meanings.definition: The ability to resist burning or catching fire.
meanings.sent1: The incombustibilities of the fabric saved the child from harm in the fire.
meanings.sent2: The incombustibilities of the wood made it ideal for crafting fire-resistant furniture.
meanings.sent3: The incombustibilities of the marshmallows made them perfect for roasting over the campfire.
meanings.sent4: His courage in the face of danger was like the incombustibilities of a warrior's spirit.
meanings.sent5: The incombustibilities of the special coating protected the spacecraft during reentry.
